intro: Centaurea stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Centaurea stenophylla is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
